Description: Much of a Corinthian black-glazed pottery kotyle (mended from numerous fragments); interior: glazed black (only traces remaining); exterior: mostly worn; black upper zone below rim; below, three narrow bands in added white; frieze of very slim rays above foot; traces of narrow bands below junction of base and foot and beneath foot; on underside, traces of bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Amyx and Lawrence, ‘Archaic Corinthian Pottery and the Anaploga Well’, Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens - Volume VII, Part II, Princeton (1975), pl. 66, no. AN 54.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 370)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.252) (phase 3)
